topic.question: 1. The customer waited for the cashier. What did the customer want to do?
2. The weatherman said it might rain tomorrow. What is the weather outlook for tomorrow?
3. Jack spilt the soda water. What was spilt?
4. Sgt Walker told his men to hurry. What did he tell them to do?
5. Mr. Williams. went to the barbershop to get a haircut. Then he went to the post office to get some stamps. Where did Mr. Williams go after getting a haircut?
6. Carl said, " I need to buy a pair of new shoes but I don't have the time."
option: Carl bought a pair of shoes.
Carl has time to do some shopping.
He doesn't have time to buy new shoes.
He doesn't have the money to buy the shoes.

topic.question: 7. Traffic is heavy in town during the rush hour.
option: There are many cars on the street.
There are few cars on the street.

topic.question: 8. When I am at home I like to take it easy.
option: I like to study a lot.
I like to take a bath.

topic.question: 9. Is this your favorite?
10. Why did Joe take his cloths to the laundry?
11. The men planted a dozen trees. How many trees did they plant?
12. Jack finished his studies at a quarter after eight. When did Jack finish his studies?
13. Rebecca wanted cash for her car when she sold it. What did she want?
14. Mary appreciates her friends. How does she feel about her friends?
option: She pays no attention to them.

topic.question: 15. Before he can do anything else, John needs more data. What does he need?
16. Where is a person's neck?
option: between his foot and his leg
between his hand and his arm
between his legs and his back
between his shoulders and his head

topic.question: 17.  Tony got a good mark in conduct. What did he get a good mark in?

18. Mr. Long said, "I haven't seen Tom since the day before yesterday." When was the last time
that Mr. Long saw Tom?
19. The instructor told the class how to reach the laboratory.
option: The instructor wanted to get to the laboratory early.
The instructor got to the laboratory late.
The instructor told the class how to get there.
The class went directly to the laboratory.

topic.question: 20. My car is out of order.
option: I keep it outside at night.
I have bought a new one.

topic.question: 21. The bank is opposite the post office.
option: The bank is on a different street.
The bank is across the street from the post office.
The bank is just behind the post office.
The bank is next to the post office.

topic.question: 22. The highways in some states are very narrow.
23. Mrs. Smith is looking for a new dress.
option: She was trying to find one.
She didn't want to look at one.

topic.question: 24. He has just been assigned to a new job.
option: He was recently assigned to a new job
He was assigned to the job several months ago.
He was never assigned to the new job.
He was once assigned to a new job.

topic.question: 25. The car is covered with dirt.
26. Take your time.
27. How were you able to cross the Atlantic Ocean in such a short time?
28. The dust is all over the room. Where is the dust?
option: There's no dust in the room.
There's dust everywhere in the room.
There's only a little dust in the room.

topic.question: 29. Will you get through your homework soon?
option: Yes, I think I'll start it soon.
Yes, it'll take some time to do.
Yes, I need to go through it.

topic.question: 30. Mary wants to serve in the hospital. What does she want to do in the hospital?
31. He was given an order to report to the office. What was he given?
32. His engine cut out when he was in eight thousand feet. What happened to his engine?
option: It started after being off a while.

topic.question: 33. Adam prefers a red car.
option: Adam has won a red car.
Adam likes to race in his red car.
Adam always talks about this red car.
Adam would rather have a red car.

topic.question: 34. Bill will go to the doctor if he feels worse tomorrow.
option: Bill might go to the doctor.
Bill won't go to the doctor.

topic.question: 35.  Let me get my coat, Robert.
option: Robert doesn't want to get his coat.
Allow me to get my coat.

topic.question: 36. There weren't any seats available for the show.
option: There were plenty of seats left.
Half of the seats could be used.

topic.question: 37. The tool was wrapped in paper.
option: The paper was put inside the tool.
The too was explained on paper.
The tool was covered with paper.
The tool was used to cut the paper.

topic.question: 38. Before you cash a check, you must endorse it.
option: You must complete an application form.
You must keep it flat at all times.
You must write your name on the back

topic.question: 39. Mike spread out the maps.
40. The students made up their minds to go to the party.
option: They did not worry about the party.
They could not decide about going.
They are not going to the party.

topic.question: 41. Mr. Jones missed the point.
option: He turned at the wrong intersection.
He has sharpened his pencil already.

topic.question: 42. The instructor wrote a problem on the chalkboard and asked a student to work it out.
option: The instructor asked the student to present a problem.
The student was asked to solve the problem.
The student asked the instructor to take the problem out.
The instructor wanted the problem to remain unsolved.

topic.question: 43. Would you keep an eye on my luggage for me?
44. Only authorized personnel may enter that office. Who may enter?
option: only the people who live in the building

topic.question: 45. The man told his patient to rest after every meal.
46. As the apple fell, its velocity increased. What happened as the apple fell?
47. He could feel the plane vibrating. What was the plane doing?
48. Why did Jane have goose bumps?
49. The report had to be amended.
50. Harold approached the woman.
51. When the group finished their work, they got time off for a job well done.
option: The group had to work until quitting time.
The group came back to finish the job.
The group was permitted to leave early.
The group took more time to do the job.

topic.question: 52. Be sure you watch carefully before you drive on the highway.
option: Be sure to look at your watch.
Be sure to get off the road.
Be sure to take care of the car.

topic.question: 53. Oil is abundant in this state.
54. This is a pretty stiff course.
option: It is a very simple course.

topic.question: 55. Why did the welder use goggles?
56. The enemy gave up to the superior forces. What did the enemy do?

57. M: Have you seen my new dog?
W: Yes. He's very nice.
Q: How does the woman feel about the dog?

58. M: Did John use the highway?
W: Yes, he did.
Q: What was John doing?

59. W: Look! Mary is running down the street.
M: Why would she do that?
Q: What does the man want to know?

60. W: What does Mr. Cobb do for a living?
M: He writes fiction.
Q: What does Mr. Cobb do?

61. W: Doctor, can't you help us?
M: I am sorry I can't. I don't have my instruments.
Q: What does the doctor need?

62. W: This restaurant is very crowded.
M: I know, but we have reservations.
Q: What does the man mean?
option: Places are being saved for them.
A special meal is being prepared for them.
There is a crowd there to greet them.

topic.question:
63. M: Why don't you come over here and sit beside me?
W: Thank you, I'll be glad to.
Q: Where will the woman sit?

64. M: Did you see the new tank?
W: No, but I saw the design for it.
Q: What did the woman see?

65. W: Where should we meet tomorrow? I think this corner would be good.
M: I was going to say the post office, but now I think we'd better meet right here.
Q: Where will the man and the woman probably meet?

66. M: How much do I owe you?
W: That's a dollar and a half.
M: Here are two one-dollar bills. Keep the change.
Q: What has happened?
option: The man gave her one dollar and fifty cents.
The man wants some change back.
The lady will have to pay him fifty cents.
